basics.name: Richmond S. Newman
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Richmond has earned degrees from the University of Washington and Michigan.  As a graduate student at the University of Michigan he wrote software to analyze statistical mechanical simulations of nanoparticles in order to study the thermodynamics of self-assembly. His interests are generally broader than this specific work, and he is enthusiastic about applying science and numerical data analysis to solve real-world problems.  At the present he is analyzing data at the Seattle Cancer Care Alliance supporting efforts to develop clinical pathways.

work.summary: Assisted in constructing and implementing a data model to allow for analytical evaluation of clinical treatment pathways.
highlights: Implemented a graph database in Neo4j to model clinical pathways and associated data

work.summary: Performed research in the field of computational statistical mechanics by simulating the self-assembly of polyhedral nanoparticles.
highlights: Implemented crystal identification techniques based on spherical harmonics for the group
Conducted free energy calculations of nucleation energy barriers in hard polyhedra
Supervised research projects of other students leading to further publications

publications.name: Shape Controls Crystallization Pathways in Fluids of ccp-forming Hard Polyhedra
publications.authors: Richmond S. Newman, Samanthule Nola, Julia Dschemuchadse, Sharon C. Glotzer
publications.publisher: In preparation for Physical Review Letters
publications.summary: Performed free energy calculations to characterize how faceting affects the stability of hard polyhedral nuclei and can promote crystallization.

publications.name: Shape-Dependent Ordering of Gold Nanocrystals into Large-Scale Superlattices
publications.authors: Jianxiao Gong, Richmond S. Newman, Michael Engel, Sharon C. Glotzer, Zhiyong Tang
publications.summary: Contributed simulations and understanding of the homogeneous and heterogeneous nucleation describing our collaborators system of gold nanopolyhedra, and helped understand the presence of defects and polymorphic crystal structures appear.

publications.name: Size- and Shape-Controlled Synthesis of Doped LiYF4 Upconversion Nanophosphors and their Shape-Directed Self-Assembly
